byline.contributor: Nick Wingfield reported from Seattle and Vindu Goel from San Francisco. Megha Bahree contributed reporting from New Delhi.
byline.original: By NICK WINGFIELD and VINDU GOEL

abstract: Amazon may not be able to comply with new and rapidly-promulgated rules by India regulating e-commerce operations in country; Amazon and rivals are in seeming violation of regulations regarding pricing and sourcing of sales, but are continuing to evaluate rules and communicate with government.
lead_paragraph: The government added regulations related to pricing and the sourcing of sales on sites that Amazon and several rivals appear to break.

headline.main: Amazon May Violate India’s New Rules on Foreign E-Commerce
headline.print_headline: Amazon May Run Afoul of India’s New Rules for E-Commerce

snippet: The government added regulations related to pricing and the sourcing of sales on sites that Amazon and several rivals appear to break.
